name: Iqra Fund
mission: Iqra Fund provides preschool programs for communities to teach children ages four to six years old basic language, social, and formal learning skills to help them succeed in primary school.
programs: Primary and Secondary School Support for Girls
theoryOfChange: Iqra Fund explicitly states its 'Theory of Change' on its 'Our Model' page. The theory is grounded in the idea that if girls have an education, communities thrive, nations flourish, and overall planetary health improves. For girls in northern Pakistan, access to quality education is seen as the key to breaking intergenerational poverty, fostering community development, and strengthening regional health. The organization's strategic priorities to achieve this include Community Engagement, Teacher Training & Development, Learning Environments, Student Success, and Access to Higher Education and Career Pathways.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 34/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: Iqra Fund earns 77/100 due to exceptional impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.iqrafund.org/donate (Source: https://www.iqrafund.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: Iqra Fund holds a 100.0/100 rating for accountability and financial health.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides a policy for zakat donations.
Total revenue for the period was $991,974.
The charity provides tuition assistance and employs program staff in the region.
The organization supports girls in primary through secondary school and tracks village enrollment rates.
The charity offers various donation options including zakat-eligible giving methods.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Iqra Fund earns a strong overall rating due to its exceptional financial transparency, high program expense ratio, and clear alignment with urgent global education needs.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital reserves are currently at 6.8 months, which is stable but lower than some long-term peers
Geographic concentration of programs may limit broader global impact

dimension_explanations.alignment: Iqra Fund shows high alignment for donors interested in global education, specifically targeting early childhood and female literacy [1][8]. The organization's zakat-eligible status and focus on high-urgency educational gaps make it a strong fit for Muslim donors [2][10].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through capacity building, focusing on teacher professional development and tuition assistance for girls [5][8]. With a total revenue of $991,974 and a program expense ratio of 85.9%, the charity efficiently converts donations into educational outcomes [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Iqra Fund empowers underserved communities through comprehensive educational support and early childhood development programs.
strengths: Maintains a perfect Charity Navigator score of 100.0/100 for accountability and finance
High program efficiency with 85.9% of expenses dedicated to direct services
Strong fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.07 to raise every $1
baseline_narrative.summary: Iqra Fund provides preschool programs and primary through secondary school support to ensure children, particularly girls, gain essential language and social skills [1][5]. The organization is recognized for its high financial accountability and is zakat-eligible for donors seeking to support educational equity [2][10].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Iqra Fund earns a strong overall rating due to its exceptional financial transparency, high program expense ratio, and clear alignment with urgent global education needs.

areas_for_improvement.context: While highly effective, programs are currently <cite id="16">concentrated within Pakistan</cite>, which may limit the organization's ability to scale its model to other underserved regions.
The organization experienced significant revenue shifts, with <cite id="17">revenue moving from $4.85 million in 2022 to $991,974 in 2023</cite>.

bbb_assessment.summary: Organization holds a perfect Charity Navigator score but has not yet completed a BBB Wise Giving Alliance review.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains <cite id="14">6.8 months of working capital</cite> to mitigate funding volatility.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="17">recent decline in annual revenue</cite> and the <cite id="16">limited geographic reach</cite> compared to larger educational NGOs.

confidence.data_freshness: Most data from 2023 and 2024 tax filings
confidence.notes: Strong data availability with perfect accountability scores.

alignment.explanation: Strong alignment for Muslim donors through <cite id="8">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and focus on <cite id="21">fi sabilillah (in the way of Allah)</cite> asnaf.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="3">perfect Charity Navigator score</cite> and <cite id="4">Candid Platinum status</cite>. Governance is robust with an <cite id="18">88% independent board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could pursue <cite id="19">BBB Wise Giving Alliance accreditation</cite> to complement its existing ratings.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by an <cite id="6">84.7% program ratio</cite> and a highly efficient <cite id="10">$138.09 cost per beneficiary</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement could be strengthened by <cite id="20">tracking more than two outcome metrics</cite> via Candid to provide deeper longitudinal data.

rich_narrative.headline: Iqra Fund empowers underserved communities through comprehensive educational support and early childhood development programs.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize high financial efficiency and want to support zakat-eligible educational empowerment for girls in Pakistan.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through educational equity
Value organizations with perfect transparency ratings
Prefer lean operations where over 80% of funds reach the field
Focus on long-term community capacity building
giving_considerations: Gifts support a smaller, highly specialized organization
Revenue has shown volatility in recent years
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking a large-scale global organization with operations in dozens of countries.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization <cite id="20">tracks specific outcome metrics</cite> and maintains a high impact-to-cost ratio.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Iqra Fund utilizes a <cite id="13">clear theory of change</cite> focused on early childhood development and tuition assistance to create long-term educational access.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that tuition assistance leads to actual school enrollment and retention.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Given the <cite id="17">recent revenue decrease</cite>, the organization has significant capacity to absorb new funding to restore and expand programs.

strengths.detail: The charity maintains a <cite id="3">perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> for accountability and finance, alongside the <cite id="4">Candid Platinum Seal</cite>.
Iqra Fund directs <cite id="6">84.7% of its total expenses</cite> toward direct services, significantly exceeding the <cite id="9">peer median of 78.4%</cite>.
The organization achieves an <cite id="10">impact cost of $138.09 per beneficiary</cite>, which is considered exceptional for global education initiatives.

strengths_deep_dive: Iqra Fund's operational model is characterized by lean management and high direct-impact ratios. Their <cite id="11">fundraising efficiency is notable</cite>, spending only <cite id="12">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite>. This financial discipline is paired with a <cite id="13">documented theory of change</cite> that focuses on capacity building within local communities. By maintaining <cite id="14">6.8 months of working capital</cite>, the organization demonstrates strong fiscal resilience, ensuring that educational programs for <cite id="15">girls in primary and secondary school</cite> remain stable despite economic fluctuations.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2011, Iqra Fund is a specialized educational non-profit dedicated to providing <cite id="1">preschool programs and primary through secondary school support</cite> for underserved communities in Pakistan. The organization focuses on <cite id="2">comprehensive educational support and early childhood development</cite>, specifically targeting children ages four to six to prepare them for formal learning. Iqra Fund maintains an exceptional reputation for financial integrity, holding a <cite id="3">perfect 100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="4">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>. Financially, the organization operates with high efficiency, reporting <cite id="5">total revenue of $991,974</cite> in 2023 with a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 85.9%</cite>. This ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund <cite id="7">tuition assistance and program staff in the region</cite>. For Muslim donors, the organization is <cite id="8">zakat-eligible</cite>, providing a verified pathway to support educational equity as a form of long-term empowerment.
